section.title: Element Search
section.p:
Element searching allows you to place the cursor over just about any element in a source file (method call, class name, field) and search for the declarations or references of that element using the command
:JavaSearch

All of the results will be placed into vim's quickfix window so that you can easily navigate the results. If only one result is found and that result is in the current source file, the cursor will be moved to that element found.

section.title: Pattern Search
section.p:
Pattern searching provides a means to widen a search beyond a single element. A pattern search can be executed using the command
:JavaSearch -p <pattern> -t <type> -x <context>
section.note:
Vim command completion is supported for through out the command with the excption of the pattern to search for.
:JavaSearch <Tab>
:JavaSearch -p MyClass* <Tab>
:JavaSearch -p MyClass* -t <Tab>
:JavaSearch -p MyClass* -t all <Tab>
:JavaSearch -p MyClass* -t all -x <Tab>
:JavaSearch -p MyClass* -t all -x declarations

ul.li:
pattern: The pattern to search for.
Ex.
MyClass*
MyClass.someMethod*

type: The type of element to search for where possible types include
annotation
class
classOrEnum
classOrInterface
constructor
enum
field
interface
method
package
type

context: The context to search under where possible context values include
all
declarations
implementors
references
